meanings.definition: To gather or form into a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: She conglobes her toys into a neat pile before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The children conglobes their building blocks to create a tower.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel conglobes all the nuts in one spot for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The artist conglobes various colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The chef conglobes the ingredients to make a delicious soup.

meanings.sent1: The snowball rolled down the hill, growing larger as it conglobes more snow.
meanings.sent2: The planets in our solar system are like conglobes floating in space.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked like a sweet conglobes of frosting and layers.
meanings.sent4: The boulder at the top of the mountain is a massive conglobes of rocks.
meanings.sent5: The crystal ball was a mysterious conglobes of light and shadows.
